column5: Brian, Thanks for the gps co-ordinates!!!!   Makes my pre fishing easier for The Open...just kidding. Good to see you had a great time out there and got into some nice fish!!!  I also had cranking battery issues this weekend. My son was in the boat the day before and turned on my navigation switch and it drained my battery.  Lesson learned..
nicely done Brian, keep those north end spots a secret
Marcel,mine was leaving the livewell pump on,last year was the nav light switch.  Steve the north is safe,I say nothing about the good spots.LOL
Very Impressive fish and in a short period of time. Do they fight as well this time of year as in the summer? In the summer they fought to the death!! I had to revive every single fish...
Bass is beautiful! Nice fesh Brian! Dang you sound Canadian in the video.
WTG Brian on the nice hawgs.

Johnny Im going to say they fight just as hard,but have a pound extra on them.LOL The live well helps with recooping them. All fish were brought in slow.I kept the rod tip down deep as possible to prevent jumps. I also when back to straight p-line florclear. No PP backing.   Thats funny,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, I thought I sounded like I was still drunk from the night before.LOL   HICUP.
Nice Haul for sure... gotta love those smallies
Good to hear they are safe Brian.
Lets hope they work at the BBM event.
Awesome fish Brian.  What does that beast on the right hand side go...looks like a striped carp!

Carp????????????????LOL  I didnt have a scale. I,ll be picking one up this weekend so I know EXACTLY what I have. Im sure it was 5+. I have caught so many small fish this year 2,s and 3,s,they all  looked like 7,s coming to the boat. L M A O    Thanks bud.

With a party the night before it was a late start to the morning.The mrs,s stayed home to sleep so I headed off alone.It was even a later start when I had to change a dead cranking battery. So by 8 ish I was on my spot and I had no idea today was going to be as sweet as it was. After reading a few reports of the slow bite I wasnt sure what to expect.  Water temps were 63,still pretty warm I think.  I started out in 15 fow and worked a jerk bait with very limited success as I had a few foloowes but nothing big. Grabbed my go to tube and thats where it all came together. I had drifted off my spot and had some good hook marks,so I dropped the tube over the edge,hit the bottom twitch and slam,fish on. It was a good one as it held the rod down and did the reel screaming thing.  Get it to the surface and it,s a 4+ fattie.Man what a nice fish. I continued this and with in an hour and a half I had 5 fish in the well. All came on the tube. It was unbilieveable. Im guessing in had over 20+ and thats a personal best for me.            Heres the vid to comfirm what Im holding.
Great job Brian!
Pretty nice haul for 90 minutes work Brian
nice fish
Those are some nice looking smallies in a short amount of time to! GOOD JOB!
WTG...Brian  Where are they when you're fishing a tournament eh?...
way to go!!!  kevin
Gotta love it, WTG...
Way to go Brian, awesome  Joey
Wow great fish. That Smallie in the last picture - left hand - has some beautiful markings. Gotta love it when they get dark markings like that.   Hookset.
bunch of nice fish,congrats
chunky bass nice job
Great catch brian !!!!! nice report man,those smallies are BIG,   right on man cool pics as well...cheers
Nice smallies Brian, Iv'e been grounded with pneumonia! can't wait to get out there next week.  Mark

Thanks all.  This time last year the boat was wrapped and packed away for the hunting season.After last years weather I said not a chance ,Im not  going to miss those big fat smallies.  Mark hope you get well soon,se ya out there. I was checking this spot for the next two up coming tourneys ,just in case the big lake blows up.  Thanks Lew, and Norm all my prefish this season seem to be bigger then my tourney fish. What up with that.LOL
those are huge, are you sure they are not US submarines trying to invade us?
Nice going Brian. For those of that are inept, post the pictures of the GPS with the digits. Great Going.
SugarPacket, where did  you go?  A really excellent post,  btw.
Nice fish, Fish.
Congratulations Brian.  Some beautiful fish there.
nice sized smallies you got there and great pics too, keep it up.
Very nice Mr.B! Days like those don't come along often enough.
Nice fish....are you and Lew related?  again no smile.
Silly me,what was I thinking Mark.LOL   I think that one I said was a three was more like 4,.Thats the single one,they were so fat.  Thanks again all.

Wow...those are great smallies!  Sounded like they had some good fight in them too.  The video was a nice touch.  I've enjoyed all your bass reports this year....so much so that I actually went out to target them a few times with fellow OFNers.
